actions: Resolves toxicity, strongly kills parasites, generates flesh and promotes the healing of sores.
Expels toxins, generates flesh, absorbs Dampness, promotes healing and stops itching.
Clears Heat, relieves toxicity and prevents putrefaction.

contraindications: Because of the toxicity of Cinnabaris Zhu Sha, long-term use is discouraged. Recalcitrant lesions should be treated with a different medication.

notes: Grind Qing Fen and Qian Dan into fine powders (Zhu Sha is already powdered) . Heat the sesame oil in a nonmetallic pan until just boiling. Add the beeswax and continue boiling until the yellow froth disappears. Immediately transfer the liquid into a pre-heated amber jar with a lid. Slowly stir in the powders until well mixed. allow to congeal. Apply the ointment to the affected areas. Dry with a hand-held hair dryer to heat the area (medium or low setting) for 10-20 minutes. Do not overheat. Wipe off the ointment with a sterile cotton ball. Apply once daily for four weeks.
